definitions.definition: A building or institution where money (originally, only coins ) is produced under government licence.
( informal ) A vast sum of money ; ( by extension ) a large amount of something.
examples: That house is worth a mint .
It must have cost a mint to produce!

definitions.definition: ( figuratively ) Any place regarded as a source of unlimited supply; the supply itself.

main_definition: A building or institution where money (originally, only coins ) is produced under government licence.
secondary_definitions: ( informal ) A vast sum of money ; ( by extension ) a large amount of something.
( figuratively ) Any place regarded as a source of unlimited supply; the supply itself.

definitions.definition: Any plant in the genus Mentha in the family Lamiaceae , typically aromatic with square stems.
The flavoring of the plant, either a sweet, a jelly or sauce.
A green color, like that of mint.
A mint-flavored candy , often eaten to sweeten the smell of the breath .

main_definition: Any plant in the genus Mentha in the family Lamiaceae , typically aromatic with square stems.
secondary_definitions: The flavoring of the plant, either a sweet, a jelly or sauce.
A green color, like that of mint.
A mint-flavored candy , often eaten to sweeten the smell of the breath .

definitions.definition: An intent , a purpose ; an attempt , a try ; an effort , an endeavor .

main_definition: ( provincial , Northern England , Scotland ) An intent , a purpose ; an attempt , a try ; an effort , an endeavor .
